ç´ç· |image = Platform of Red Line in Formosa Boulevard Station.JPG |caption = [[Formosa Boulevard Station]] Red Line platform |type = [[Rapid transit]] |locale = [[Kaohsiung]], [[Taiwan]] |start = [[Ciaotou Station]] |end = [[Siaogang Station|Siaogang]] |stations = 24 |open = March 9, 2008 |operator = [[Kaohsiung Mass Rapid Transit]] |character = Underground/At-Grade/Elevated |depot = North Depot,South Depot |linelength = {{convert|14.4|km|mi|1|abbr=on}} |notrack = 2 |gauge = {{RailGauge|sg}} |speed = |el = [[Third rail]] (750 [[volt]]s [[Direct Current|DC]]) |map = }} {{Chinese|t=ç´ç·|p=HÃ³ng-XiÃ n|tp=HÃ³ng-SiÃ n|w=Hung2- Hsien4|poj=Ãng-SoÃ â¿}} The '''Red Line''' is the {{convert|28.3|km|mi}} north-south [[mass transit]] line of the [[Kaohsiung Mass Rapid Transit]] in [[Kaohsiung]], [[Taiwan]]. It is the first mass transit line built in southern Taiwan, started construction on October 24, 2001 and opened for service on March 9, 2008 with a month-long free ride service to April 6.{{cite news|url=http://www.ettoday.com/2008/03/10/329-2242867.htm|title=é«å¸ï¼ç´ç·éäºãé«æ·å¬å¸åæ©ç·8æéè» (in Chinese)|publisher=[[ETtoday]]|author=å»åé|date=2008-03-10|accessdate=2008-03-10}} There is a plan to extend the line north to [[Luzhu District]].
